availability_zones.description: The list of Availability zones to use for nodepool. This can only be specified if the type of the nodepool is AvailabilitySet.

count.description: Count is the number of nodes

enable_node_public_ip.description: Whether each node is allocated its own public IP

max_pods.description: The maximum number of pods that can run on a node

mode.description: The mode of the nodepool. Allowed values include: SYSTEM or USER. A cluster must have at least one 'SYSTEM' nodepool at all times.

node_image_version.description: The node image version of the nodepool.

node_labels.description: The node labels to be persisted across all nodes in nodepool

os_disk_size_gb.description: OS Disk Size in GB to be used to specify the disk size for every machine in the nodepool. If you specify 0, it will apply the default osDisk size according to the vmSize specified

os_disk_type.description: OS Disk Type. Allowed values include: EPHEMERAL or MANAGED.

os_type.description: The OS type of the nodepool. Allowed values include: LINUX.

scale_set_eviction_policy.description: Scale set eviction policy, Allowed values include: DELETE or DEALLOCATE.

scale_set_priority.description: Scale set priority. Allowed values include: REGULAR or SPOT.

type.description: The Nodepool type. Allowed values include: VIRTUAL_MACHINE_SCALE_SETS or AVAILABILITY_SET.

vnet_subnet_id.description: If this is not specified, a VNET and subnet will be generated and used. If no podSubnetID is specified, this applies to nodes and pods, otherwise it applies to just nodes

effect.description: Current effect state of the node pool

enable_public_access.description: Enable cluster API server access from the internet. public_access_cidrs.description: Specify which addresses from the internet can communicate to the public endpoint, if public endpoint is enabled (see [Amazon EKS cluster endpoint access control](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/latest/userguide/cluster-endpoint.html))

Scope for the git repository, having one of the valid scopes: cluster, cluster_group.

git_implementation.description: GitImplementation specifies which client library implementation to use. go-git is the default git implementation.

interval.description: Interval at which to check gitrepository for updates. This is the interval at which Tanzu Mission Control will attempt to reconcile changes in the repository to the cluster. A sync interval of 0 would result in no future syncs. If no value is entered, a default interval of 5 minutes will be applied as `5m`.

secret_ref.description: Reference to the secret. Repository credential.

url.description: URL of the git repository. Repository URL should begin with http, https, or ssh

branch.description: Branch from git to checkout. When branch is given, then that branch from the git repository will be checked out. If the given branch doesnt exist in the git repository, then adding the git repository will fail. If no branch is given, the `master` branch will be used.

commit.description: Commit SHA to checkout. Takes precedence over all other reference fields. When git_implementation is `GO_GIT`, this can be combined with branch to shallow clone branch in which the commit is expected to exist.

semver.description: SemVer expression to checkout from git tags. Takes precedence over tag. When semver is given, then the latest tag matching that semver will be checked out from the git repository. If no tag in the git repository matches semver, then adding the git repository will fail. If semver is given, tag and branch will be ignored if they are populated.

tag.description: Tag from git to checkout. Takes precedence over branch. When a tag is given, that tag from the git repository will be checked out. If the given tag doesnt exist in the git repository, then adding the git repository will fail. If both tag and branch are given, tag overrides branch and the branch value will be ignored.

block.description: Reference specifies git reference to resolve.
Spec for the Repository.

block.description: Subject for this rolebinding.

requiredigest.description: The flag used to enforce digest to appear in container images.

Scope for the kustomization, having one of the valid scopes: cluster, cluster_group.

interval.description: Interval defines the interval at which to reconcile kustomization.

path.description: Path within the source from which configurations will be applied. The path must exactly match what is in the repository.

prune.description: If true, the workloads will be deleted when the kustomization CR is deleted. When prune is enabled, removing the kustomization will trigger a removal of all kubernetes objects previously applied on all clusters of this cluster group by this kustomization.

target_namespace.description: TargetNamespace sets or overrides the namespaces of resources/kustomization yaml while applying on cluster. Namespace specified here must exist on cluster. It won't be created as a result of specifying here. Enter the name of the namespace you want the kustomization to be synced to. Entering a target namespace removes the need to specify a namespace in your kustomization. If the namespace does not exist in the cluster, syncing the kustomization will fail.

block.description: Reference to the source from which the configurations will be applied. Please select an existing repository.

Scope for the custom, security, image, network and namespace quota policy, having one of the valid scopes for custom, security and namespace quota policy: cluster, cluster_group or organization and valid scopes for image and network policy: workspace or organization.

limits_cpu.description: The sum of CPU limits across all pods in a non-terminal state cannot exceed this value

limits_memory.description: The sum of memory limits across all pods in a non-terminal state cannot exceed this value

persistent_volume_claims.description: The total number of PersistentVolumeClaims that can exist in a namespace

persistent_volume_claims_per_class.description: Across all persistent volume claims associated with each storage class, the total number of persistent volume claims that can exist in the namespace

requests_cpu.description: The sum of CPU requests across all pods in a non-terminal state cannot exceed this value

requests_memory.description: The sum of memory requests across all pods in a non-terminal state cannot exceed this value

requests_storage.description: The sum of storage requests across all persistent volume claims cannot exceed this value

requests_storage_per_class.description: Across all persistent volume claims associated with each storage class, the sum of storage requests cannot exceed this value

resource_counts.description: The total number of Services of the given type that can exist in a namespace

port.description: The port on the given protocol. This can either be a numerical or named port on a pod.

protocol.description: The protocol (TCP or UDP) which traffic must match.

block.description: List of destination ports for outgoing traffic. Each item in this list is combined using a logical OR. Default is this rule matches all ports (traffic not restricted by port).

cidr.description: CIDR is a string representing the IP Block Valid examples are "192.168.1.1/24" or "2001:db9::/64"

except.description: Except is a slice of CIDRs that should not be included within an IP Block Valid examples are "192.168.1.1/24" or "2001:db9::/64" Except values will be rejected if they are outside the CIDR range

block.description: IPBlock defines policy on a particular IPBlock. If this field is set then neither of the namespaceSelector and PodSelector can be set.

namespace_selector.description: Use a label selector to identify the namespaces to allow as egress destinations.

pod_selector.description: Use a label selector to identify the pods to allow as egress destinations.

block.description: The rule Spec (destination) for Selectors.
List of destinations for outgoing traffic of pods selected for this rule. Default is the rule matches all destinations (traffic not restricted by destinations).
This specifies list of egress rules to be applied to the selected pods.

block.description: List of ports which should be made accessible on the pods selected for this rule. Each item in this list is combined using a logical OR. Default is this rule matches all ports (traffic not restricted by port).

cidr.description: CIDR is a string representing the IP Block Valid examples are "192.168.1.1/24" or "2001:db9::/64"

except.description: Except is a slice of CIDRs that should not be included within an IP Block Valid examples are "192.168.1.1/24" or "2001:db9::/64" Except values will be rejected if they are outside the CIDR range

availability_zones.description: The list of Availability zones to use for nodepool. This can only be specified if the type of the nodepool is AvailabilitySet.

count.description: Count is the number of nodes

enable_node_public_ip.description: Whether each node is allocated its own public IP

max_pods.description: The maximum number of pods that can run on a node

mode.description: The mode of the nodepool. Allowed values include: SYSTEM or USER. A cluster must have at least one 'SYSTEM' nodepool at all times.

node_image_version.description: The node image version of the nodepool.

node_labels.description: The node labels to be persisted across all nodes in nodepool

os_disk_size_gb.description: OS Disk Size in GB to be used to specify the disk size for every machine in the nodepool. If you specify 0, it will apply the default osDisk size according to the vmSize specified

os_disk_type.description: OS Disk Type. Allowed values include: EPHEMERAL or MANAGED.

os_type.description: The OS type of the nodepool. Allowed values include: LINUX.

scale_set_eviction_policy.description: Scale set eviction policy, Allowed values include: DELETE or DEALLOCATE.

scale_set_priority.description: Scale set priority. Allowed values include: REGULAR or SPOT.

type.description: The Nodepool type. Allowed values include: VIRTUAL_MACHINE_SCALE_SETS or AVAILABILITY_SET.

vnet_subnet_id.description: If this is not specified, a VNET and subnet will be generated and used. If no podSubnetID is specified, this applies to nodes and pods, otherwise it applies to just nodes
